name: Clipper Access (Formerly RTC Clipper)
description: Reduced fares for riders with disabilities
fullDescription: The Regional Transit Connection's (RTC) Clipper Access card provides discounted fares for people with disabilities on participating Bay Area transit systems.
whatTheyOffer:
- Reduced fares on most Bay Area transit agencies
- Typically 50% or more off regular adult fares
- Valid on BART, Muni, AC Transit, Caltrain, and more
- Discounts automatically applied when using a Clipper Access card
howToGetIt:
1. Complete the RTC application at 511.org
2. Provide proof of disability (Medicare card, SSI/SSDI documentation, or medical certification)
3. Submit application online or by mail
4. Once approved, receive RTC Clipper card by mail
5. Load cash value and ride with automatic discounts
cost: Free for initial and renewal apps. Replacement cards have a $3 fee.
requirements: Clipper Access offers two eligibility pathways: Basic Eligibility and Medical Eligibility. Review the Information Sheet for New Applicants (PDF)(PDF file opens in a new window) to determine which application is best for you.
howToApply: First-time applicants must apply in person at select Bay Area transit agency locations. Once an application is received, a verifier reviews it to ensure that it is completed and signed, with supporting documentation included. Qualified applicants are mailed a Clipper Access card typically within 21 days of approval.
